bibl.title: Dispatch from Robert S. Newton to Frederick W. Seward
Despatches from United States consuls in St. Paul de Loanda, 1854-1893

revisionDesc.change: Creation of individual xml files, review, and addition encoding

div1.opener:
No 26.
United States Consulate
at St Paul de Loanda
18th September 1878.
div1.p:
Sir,
I have the honor to acknowledge reciept of despatch No. 11 addressed to Consul Jackson also despatch dated 5th July informing me that Mr William St Thomas has been appointed Consul for this Port.
On arrival of Mr Thomas I shall deliver over to him all the Archives, records and other property in my possession in accordance with instructions.

As it is necessary that I should proceed to England about the end of this year I have to request the Department to grant me leave of absence for six months, and in the event of Consul Thomas not having arrived at this Port I
I beg to suggest to the Department to allow me to leave the consulate in charge of Mr. Andrew Gaebraith Colville during my absence. This gentleman is of the highest respectability and is a Merchant of several years standing in this place.

closer.salute:
I have the honor to be
Sir,
Your obedient servant

address.addrLine: To the Assistant Secretary of State
